## Public Member Functions

### adjustForSegmentedStacks() {#a62042f5fd3a2df1b4fab2bfc692b2390}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void ARMFrameLowering::adjustForSegmentedStacks (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; PrologueMBB) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Adjust the prologue to have the function use segmented stacks.

This works by adding a check even before the &quot;normal&quot; function prologue.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-h/#l00069">69</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-h">ARMFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp/#l03155">3155</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp">ARMFrameLowering.cpp</a>.

### canSimplifyCallFramePseudos() {#a5a1aad4b6babbb473d1b342d32125d14}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ARMFrameLowering::canSimplifyCallFramePseudos (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
canSimplifyCallFramePseudos - If there is a reserved call frame, the call frame pseudos can be simplified.

Unlike most targets, having a FP is not sufficient here since we still may reference some objects via SP even when FP is available in Thumb2 mode.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-h/#l00051">51</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-h">ARMFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp/#l00379">379</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp">ARMFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### determineCalleeSaves() {#af2f88cb2b4134972392e4efa778596d6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void ARMFrameLowering::determineCalleeSaves (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitvector">BitVector</a> &amp; SavedRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regscavenger">RegScavenger</a> &#42; RS) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method determines which of the registers reported by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo/#ad71b5bc0aa81f5dec06cbfecaf2f7183">TargetRegisterInfo::getCalleeSavedRegs()</a> should actually get saved.

The default implementation checks populates the <code>SavedRegs</code> bitset with all registers which are modified in the function, targets may override this function to save additional registers. This method also sets up the register scavenger ensuring there is a free register or a frameindex available. This method should not be called by any passes outside of PEI, because it may change state passed in by <code>MF</code> and <code>RS</code>. The preferred interface outside PEI is getCalleeSaves.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-h/#l00059">59</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-h">ARMFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp/#l02414">2414</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp">ARMFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getCalleeSavedSpillSlots() {#a7e108cccbbb7c737a757c649c1bf823c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const TargetFrameLowering::SpillSlot &#42; ARMFrameLowering::getCalleeSavedSpillSlots (unsigned &amp; NumEntries) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
getCalleeSavedSpillSlots - This method returns a pointer to an array of pairs, that contains an entry for each callee saved register that must be spilled to a particular stack location if it is spilled.

Each entry in this array contains a &lt;register,offset&gt; pair, indicating the fixed offset from the incoming stack pointer that each register should be spilled at. If a register is not listed here, the code generator is allowed to spill it anywhere it chooses.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-h/#l00087">87</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-h">ARMFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp/#l03038">3038</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp">ARMFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getCalleeSaves() {#acb823b4b02ad10b373f131ce0180ab13}

<MemberDefinition

### hasReservedCallFrame() {#a7d1c91b20625d31982210d6fc381104d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ARMFrameLowering::hasReservedCallFrame (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
hasReservedCallFrame - Under normal circumstances, when a frame pointer is not required, we reserve argument space for call sites in the function immediately on entry to the current function.

This eliminates the need for add/sub sp brackets around call sites. Returns true if the call frame is included as part of the stack frame.

### restoreCalleeSavedRegisters() {#a03aa2120f2d9d154313c31faec3d97d2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ARMFrameLowering::restoreCalleeSavedRegisters (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> MI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mutablearrayref">MutableArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/calleesavedinfo">CalleeSavedInfo</a> &gt; CSI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo">TargetRegisterInfo</a> &#42; TRI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
restoreCalleeSavedRegisters - Issues instruction(s) to restore all callee saved registers and returns true if it isn&#39;t possible / profitable to do so by issuing a series of load instructions via loadRegToStackSlot().

If it returns true, and any of the registers in CSI is not restored, it sets the corresponding Restored flag in CSI to false. Returns false otherwise.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-h/#l00039">39</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-h">ARMFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp/#l02169">2169</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp">ARMFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["virtual"]}>
spillCalleeSavedRegisters - Issues instruction(s) to spill all callee saved registers and returns true if it isn&#39;t possible / profitable to do so by issuing a series of store instructions via storeRegToStackSlot().

Returns false otherwise.

## Private Member Functions

### eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr() {#a438e488ade8806ec8f8bc4becc799a3f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineBasicBlock::iterator ARMFrameLowering::eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> MI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method is called during prolog/epilog code insertion to eliminate call frame setup and destroy pseudo instructions (but only if the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a> is using them).

It is responsible for eliminating these instructions, replacing them with concrete instructions. This method need only be implemented if using call frame setup/destroy pseudo instructions. Returns an iterator pointing to the instruction after the replaced one.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-h/#l00103">103</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-h">ARMFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp/#l03044">3044</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armframelowering-cpp">ARMFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
